subject: Tennis
Davis Cup
Poisoning and Poisions
lead_paragraph: The International Tennis Federation is investigating allegations that Tommy Haas was poisoned before Germany’s Davis Cup match against Russia. Haas was forced out of his match against Mikhail Youzhny with a suspected stomach virus. Alexander Waske, Haas’s teammate, said he was told by a Russian who managed athletes that it was poisoning, although Waske did not identify the manager. Russia won both reverse singles matches Sept. 23 to win the semifinal series, 3-2, and reach the Davis Cup final.
